question: 1. A beginner driver (anyone who has had a regular license for less than one year) does not need to attach a beginners mark to the vehicle when borrowing a regular vehicle from others.
2. If you have a hangover and feel dizzy, you should not drive a vehicle no matter how short the distance.
3. Those who have a license for a regular automobile may not drive a truck with a maximum loading capacity of 3000 kg.
4. If a driver has possessed a license for regular vehicles or heavy-duty special vehicles for more than two years, the driver can apply for the test to obtain a medium or large vehicle license.
5. A holder of a regular vehicle license is not allowed to drive a light-duty special vehicle but is allowed to drive a moped.
6. When a regular passenger vehicle (A) tows a disabled vehicle (B), towing license is not required.
7. A driver of a regular truck has to do a daily inspection of the regular truck.
8. It is better if the operation range of the hand brake lever (or stroke of the parking brake pedal) is little when the brake lever (or pedal) is fully operated.
9. Regular vehicles for private use must be annually inspected and serviced.
10. When a regular truck is loaded, the load may exceed the width of the truck by 10% of it.
11. Three children are counted as two adults when they are under the age of twelve with regard to the passenger capacity of motor vehicles.
12. The driver must fasten the seat belt, but passengers do not need to fasten them.
13. If possible, use a child seat in the back seat when the vehicle is equipped with a passenger-side airbag.
14. If you have ensured in the side mirror that no vehicle is coming from behind, you need not use the blinkers when you start a vehicle.
15. A vehicle may enter the right side of a one-way road.
16. When a vehicle passes another vehicle ahead on the road as shown in this picture, the vehicle can enter the right side of the road.

17. Where there are three lanes or more parallel in the same direction and if the traffic signs and markings do not designate lanes specifically, regular vehicles should travel the far right lane because the speed is fast.
18. You noticed the siren of an emergency vehicle, but you were already entering an intersection, so you stopped at the intersection to give way to the emergency vehicle.

19. When a bus signals to move away from a bus stop, a vehicle coming from behind must not interfere with the bus starting to travel, except for when a driver of a vehicle needs to slam on the brakes or turn the steering wheel sharply to avoid the bus.
20. When you were driving a regular vehicle, a traffic sign indicated that the far left lane was a designated exclusive lane for buses. However, you entered the lane and turned left.
21. Mopeds should not use the lanes where the traffic sign is indicated.
22. You are banned from stopping or parking a vehicle on the side strip shown in this picture, but you are allowed to drive.
23. You must not drive on the shoulder of a road (0.5 m from the edge of a road) when passing a road without a sidewalk or side strip.
24. If you are driving on a streetcar/tram track and see a streetcar/tram approaching from the rear, you do not have to get off the track and may proceed at the same speed.
25. When passing near cyclists, you must keep a safe distance from them or proceed at slow speed.
26. When a streetcar is stopping at a stop with no safety zone and passengers are getting on or off, you must stop behind it and wait until all passengers have cleared.
27. When passing a crosswalk or a bicycle crossing lane, you must always stop even if the road is clear of pedestrians or bicycles.
28. When an unattended small child is walking along a road, you must be particularly attentive to the safe passage of the child and stop or slow down.
29. When crossing a sidewalk or the side strip of a road to enter a place along the road, you must stop before crossing even if it is plain that there is no pedestrian around it.
30. When passing an intersection, watch carefully to avoid colliding with a bicycle traversing the perpendicular road, or trapping the bicycle traveling on your left under the body of your vehicle.
31. If no limit is specified by a traffic sign or marking on a road, the maximum speed limit for regular trucks is 50 km/h.
32. Braking distance will be shorter when driving with a heavy load.
33. If you reduce your speed from 40 km/h to 20 km/h, it means 'driving slow.'
34. When you turn right or left, you need to signal about 3 seconds before doing it.
35. When the driver extends the right arm out the windows and bends the elbow upward vertically, this means a signal to turn right.
36. When traveling on a narrow road, a vehicle in front of you suddenly started to reverse, so you sounded your horn to avoid danger.
37. When the vehicle in front of you is about to overtake another vehicle, you may overtake both of these vehicles if the road ahead appears safe.
38. Vehicles are prohibited from overtaking a vehicle or moped at a crosswalk or a bicycle crossing lane and within 30 meters before them.
39. When making a right or left turn, a vehicle must proceed slowly even if a police officer is on the spot directing traffic by hand or flashlight signals (except for two-step right turn).
40. When turning left at an intersection, it is recommended that you steer to the right at first, then turn left to eliminate the turning radius difference.
41. Although the intersection ahead was congested, you entered the intersection on the green light and stopped in the middle of the intersection.
42. Within 10 meters of a bus stop signboard during bus operating hours, parking is prohibited, but stopping is not.
43. Parking and stopping are prohibited in a bicycle crossing lane and within five meters from the edge of it.
44. On the left side of a safety zone and within 10 meters from each end of the zone, you must not park or stop your vehicle.
45. Parking is prohibited in the space within 1 meter from a fire alarm, but you may stop.
46. On a road with a side strip where you may park or stop a vehicle, you must leave a space of more than 0.5 meters for pedestrian traffic.

47. If you happen to be on the scene of a traffic accident, do whatever you can to give first aid to the injured. Move the vehicle concerned, or cooperate in other ways despite the responsibility of the accident.
48. If you have no choice but to have your vehicle towed by an ordinary vehicle, you must maintain a safe distance of up to five meters between the towing vehicle and your broken vehicle.
49. If you have no choice but to leave your vehicle on a road and evacuate due to the occurrence of a major earthquake, stop the engine, open the windows, and pull out the engine key without fail.
50. If you take out a voluntary insurance policy, you do not need to have vehicle third-party liability insurance or a mutual relief system.
51. Traffic rules have been laid down as a systematic set of commitments that must be observed by everyone to ensure safe and smooth road traffic.

52. (Flashing red light) where there was a signal with a flashing red light, you traveled slowly by paying attention to other traffic because if it was late at night, there was light traffic, and you did not recognize any danger.
53. If a vehicle is rapidly approaching the stopping point at an intersection and cannot stop safely when the green signal changes to yellow, it may continue to go through the intersection.
54. This traffic sign means 'one way.'
55. This traffic sign indicates that there is a school or preschool nearby, so you have to use caution because children may be running out into the streets.
56. Large trucks and specified medium trucks are not allowed to travel on a road with this traffic sign, while heavy-duty special vehicles are allowed to travel.
57. This traffic sign indicates that regular passenger vehicles, large motor cycles, regular motor cycles, and mopeds are not allowed to travel.
58. This traffic sign indicates that vehicles are not allowed to travel due to roadwork ahead.
59. Mopeds can enter a road with this traffic sign.
60. This traffic sign indicates that any vehicles except for two-wheeled vehicles are not allowed to travel in any directions other than in the directions indicated by the arrows.
61. On a road with this traffic sign, large and regular motor cycles are not allowed to travel, while mopeds are allowed to travel.
62. When the car is traveling in the direction indicated by the arrow, this road marking indicates that there is a priority road ahead.

63. When you pass through a railroad crossing, you must stop just before it (or behind the near side of the stopping line, if any) and check for safety, but if you have good visibility at a railroad crossing, you can pass through it by allowing down.

64. When you stop your car on an uphill road following the vehicle in front of you, you should not get too close to the vehicle in front, so as to avoid a collision in the case that the other vehicle slides backward.
65. If the road has a cliff off to one side and it is not safe for two vehicles to pass each other safely, then the vehicle on the cliff side should stop and give way.
66. You have to drive more slowly at night than during the daytime because you tend to speed at night due to not being able to judge speed accurately.
67. You should avoid entering deep puddles on the road because muddy water might enter the brake drum, causing the brake not to work at all or function effectively.

68. If the engine revolutions do not decline from high-speed levels due to malfunction, you should shift the gear into neutral to divert the power of the engine from the wheels and move the vehicle to a safe place.
69. If the rear wheels of your vehicle start to skid, you should slam on the brakes because it is difficult to set the vehicle in the right direction by just adjusting the steering wheel.
70. When you drive in fog, you should sound your horn whenever necessary to prevent danger.
71. If your car stalls on a railroad crossing or an intersection, you should try to restart the engine by running the starter motor in either low or second gear.
72. If your vehicle has a flat tire while you are driving at high speed, you should slam on the brakes to stop quickly because your vehicle may move in the wrong direction in a dangerous way.
73. Main lanes of the expressway include acceleration lanes, deceleration lanes, and slow lanes.
74. When traveling on a main lane of the expressway which is not divided for each direction, the speed limit for ordinary roads is applied.
75. The speed limit for regular vehicles traveling on a main lane of the expressway that has a median strip is 80 km/h.
76. Hydroplaning is a phenomenon where the overuse of the foot brake on a long downhill road might cause the brake to overheat and fail suddenly.
77. When driving on the expressway, you drove on the side strip of the expressway because of a traffic jam.
78. You parked your vehicle on the sufficiently wide shoulder of an expressway due to vehicle breakdown for unavoidable reasons.
79. If your vehicle breaks down on an expressway, it is safe to stay inside the vehicle after calling for a tow truck.
80. You should choose a motorcycle that fits the size of your body and allows your toes to touch the ground when you are seated.
81. When riding a motorcycle, motorcyclists should wear clothing that covers their body as fully as possible.
82. Double riding is not permitted when riding on a large or regular motorcycle without a rear seat.
83. When a rider who has had a license for regular motorcycles for less than one year rides a regular motorcycle, double riding is not permitted.
84. When riding on a motorcycle, it is better to make the drive chain of the motorcycle too tight and make the steering system of the motorcycle too stiff to maintain the motorcycle's balance.
85. When maneuvering a curve, tilt the motorcycle naturally rather than turning the handlebars.
86. When riding your motorcycle on muddy or gravel roads, you should go fast by accelerating your vehicle.

87. When you ride a large or regular motorcycle and turn right on a wide road, it is dangerous to move from a left lane to a right lane abruptly, so you should gradually enter the right lane for turning right before approaching an intersection.
88. When turning right on a moped at an intersection that has this traffic sign, you must not indicate a right turn until you reach the intersection.
89. When you apply the brakes of your motorcycle, it is better to do it by always letting out the clutch.
90. When you push your motorcycle on foot with the engine running, you are regarded as a pedestrian.
